Name: Bloody Mary (no added sugar & low-calorie)
Ingredients: 10 drop Hot pepper sauce (red vinegar-based e.g. Tabasco)
Instructions: ROLL (rotate) all ingredients with ice in shaker (rather than shake) and strain into ice-filled glass. Use ice freshly from freezer to fill glass (not ice directly from ice-machine) to avoid unwanted dilution from melting ice.
Review: With vitamin loaded tomato and lemon juices, this sugar-free, low-calorie Mary is almost a healthy option. Be sure to use a tomato juice with no added sugar and be aware that adding Worcestershire sauce will also contribute a very small amount of sugar.
History: Adapted from the classic serve by yours truly (Simon Difford) in January 2019. Also see Bloody Mary cocktails - how to make, origins and history
Garnish: Spiked cocktail onion, cherry tomato and lemon wedge with celery stick stirrer (optional salt & pepper rim)
